text: Acleris okanagana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from British Columbia and Quebec.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is about 17 mm. The forewings are smoky grey with an admixture of rusty scaling. The hindwings are dirty white with faint smoky reticulation in the apical and terminal areas. Adults have been recorded on wing in June.The Canadian Entomologist; Volume 72; Issue 03; March 1940; pp. 61-62 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1940 okanagana Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris okanagana
